headline: Bad Week for Wall Street’s Old Guard as Crypto Burns the Haters
summary: (Bloomberg) -- To many on Wall Street, it’s still heresy. An asset born from anti-establishment myth, tainted by fraud and bad actors, not only survives — it thrives. Never mind the endless grift, exchange hacks, and more. headline: BlackRock says coal competition case risks US energy independence
summary: U.S. government support for a "baseless" case alleging asset managers conspired to reduce competition in the coal sector risks undermining its goal of energy independence, BlackRock, the world's biggest asset manager, said on Friday.  The U.S. Department of Justice and Federal Trade Commission on Thursday filed a statement of interest in the case by Texas and 12 other states against BlackRock and fellow large investors Vanguard and State Street Global Advisors (SSGA).
